definition: to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
to buy and sell/to do business/to trade/to deal
a one-off, short-sighted deal/a one-shot, all-out attempt

pinyin: Zheng4 quan4 Gui4 tai2 Mai3 mai4 Zhong1 xin1

sentences.english: Do a post-analysis of all your buys and sells.
sentences.chinese: 對你所有的買賣做事後分析。

sentences.english: Perhaps an import-export situation will need all your tender loving care.
sentences.chinese: 可能是一個需要你全部細緻照料的進出口買賣。

sentences.english: Therefore, all the people involved can be divided into Speculative Group and Investment Group.
sentences.chinese: 因此所有參與買賣的人可分爲投機集團和投資集團。

sentences.english: Mortgaging rural land or even selling one's own house to non-villagers is banned.
sentences.chinese: 抵押農村土地，甚至買賣房屋給非農村戶口是禁止的。

sentences.english: More trade in livestock helps to pass along nasties too.
sentences.chinese: 牲畜買賣的頻繁也幫助了病毒的傳播。
他們爲買賣商品討價還價。

sentences.english: One should not encumber oneself with hire purchase repayments at the beginning of a marriage.
sentences.chinese: 人不應該在婚姻的開始就被買賣的租金所拖累。

sentences.english: The Wrights chose to pursue sales contracts and did not compete for the prize.
sentences.chinese: 萊特兄弟選擇追求買賣合約，因此並沒有參與角逐。

sentences.english: So I said, Obama, let's go into a business.
sentences.chinese: 所以我說，奧巴馬，我們可以做買賣了。

sentences.english: Outline based on the early loco type, with typical Shay features.
sentences.chinese: 大綱的基礎上早日買賣類型，謝伊的典型特徵。

sentences.english: This energy super-charges your natural instincts making this a perfect time for anything dealing with buying or selling.
sentences.chinese: 能量控制了你的本能，這段時間特別適合買賣交易。

sentences.english: The motor and garage trades will be harmed.
sentences.chinese: 機動車買賣和車輛修理業也將受損。

sentences.english: Withers was a fool. He should have sold.
sentences.chinese: 威瑟斯太愚蠢了，他應該同意那樁買賣。

sentences.english: But they are doing their small business seriously.
sentences.chinese: 但他們都在踏實地做自己的小買賣。
你是怎麼做成這筆買賣的？

definition: to engage in (business etc)/to run/to operate
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
to have sth to do with/to relate to/related to/to concern/concerning
